com.cognifide.slice.api.provider

Interface ChildrenProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SliceChildrenProvider
    Deprecated. 
    See ModelProvider and one of its methods:
    • ModelProvider.getChildModels(Class, String)
    • ModelProvider.getChildModels(Class, Resource)
    • ModelProvider.getList(Class, java.util.Iterator)

    @Deprecated
 @ProviderType
public interface ChildrenProvider

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<String> getChildren(String path)
      Deprecated. 
      The method introduces a bad design in the code. If you are using this try replacing it by one of ModelProvider's methods. However, if you still need children of a resource, then use simply Resource.listChildren()
      List<org.apache.sling.api.resource.Resource> getChildResources(String path)
      Deprecated. 
      The method introduces a bad design in the code. If you are using this try replacing it by one of ModelProvider's methods. However, if you still need children of a resource, then use simply Resource.listChildren()

    • Method Detail

      • getChildren

        @Deprecated
List<String> getChildren(String path)
        Deprecated. The method introduces a bad design in the code. If you are using this try replacing it by one of ModelProvider's methods. However, if you still need children of a resource, then use simply Resource.listChildren()
        Returns paths of child resources of a resource under specified path. If a resource under specified path doesn't exist, empty list is returned. The method is not recursive - it reads only direct children.
        Parameters:
        path - resource path
        Returns:
        list of paths of child resources or empty list if resource doesn't exist

      • getChildResources

        @Deprecated
List<org.apache.sling.api.resource.Resource> getChildResources(String path)
        Deprecated. The method introduces a bad design in the code. If you are using this try replacing it by one of ModelProvider's methods. However, if you still need children of a resource, then use simply Resource.listChildren()
        Returns child resources of a resource under specified path. If a resource under specified path doesn't exist, empty list is returned. The method is not recursive - it reads only direct children.
        Parameters:
        path - resource path
        Returns:
        list of child resources or empty list if resource doesn't exist
